name: Fudgy Caramel Brownies
description: Rich, fudgy layered brownies baked in a 9×13-inch pan with a middle of gooey caramels and melted chocolate chips, finished with flaky sea salt.

ingredients.name: Homemade caramels or Werther’s Original soft caramels, cut in half
Maldon salt or other flaky sea salt

steps.description: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9×13-inch baking pan with oil and line the bottom and sides with parchment paper.

In a double boiler (or heatproof bowl over simmering water) melt the butter over medium heat, then add the sugar, cocoa, and salt. Stir until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is well mixed, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat.
Stir in the vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring until the mixture is silky. Add the flour and stir until fully incorporated.
Pour about one-third of the batter into the prepared pan, spreading into a thin, even layer. Bake for 10 minutes, until the bottom layer is just beginning to firm.

Remove the pan from the oven. Scatter the chocolate chips evenly over the partially baked batter, then arrange the caramels evenly over them. Spread the remaining batter over the top and smooth to the edges.
Bake about 20 minutes, until the top is just starting to firm and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with very moist crumbs attached. Sprinkle the flaky salt over the top.
Let the brownies cool completely, at least 120 minutes. Remove from the pan and cut into 12 squares.
